TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AcceptRejectRule extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Determines the action that occurs when the <xref:System.Data.DataSet.AcceptChanges%2A> or <xref:System.Data.DataTable.RejectChanges%2A> method is invoked on a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> with a <xref:System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Changes to a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> are not final until you call the <xref:System.Data.DataTable.AcceptChanges%2A> method. When either <xref:System.Data.DataTable.AcceptChanges%2A> or <xref:System.Data.DataTable.RejectChanges%2A> is called on a row in the parent table, the AcceptRejectRule value determines whether or not changes are propagated to corresponding rows in the child table.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint>, sets various of its properties, including the <xref:System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint.AcceptRejectRule%2A>, and adds it to a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> object's <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection>.
[!CODE [DataWorks Data.AcceptRejectRule#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/DataWorks Data.AcceptRejectRule#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.AcceptRejectRule Cascade = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Changes are cascaded across the relationship.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.AcceptRejectRule None = int32(0)
